Ramaiah Institute of Technology (RIT)

M S R Nagar, Bangalore
{% load static %} A+ NAAC accredited ,NAAC
Ramaiah Institute of Technology (RIT) is an esteemed engineering college in Bangalore, India. Established in 1962, it's part of the M.S. Ramaiah Foundation and is affiliated with Visvesvaraya Technological University (VTU). The institute offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in various engineering disciplines, management, computer applications, and more. RIT is known for its comprehensive curriculum, modern infrastructure, experienced faculty, and a strong emphasis on research and innovation. The college has collaborations with industry partners, enabling students to gain practical knowledge through internships and projects. Additionally, it has numerous student clubs, societies, and extracurricular activities that contribute to a well-rounded education. The campus houses state-of-the-art facilities, including laboratories, libraries, sports complexes, and hostels, providing a conducive environment for learning and personal development. RIT has a strong placement record, with students securing placements in top companies across different sectors.
Admission to all the B.Tech Programmes for the year 2024 is based on any one of the following: A candidate who has passed 10 + 2 pattern of examination (equivalent to the two year Pre University in Karnataka) with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with Chemistry/ Biotechnology/ Biology/ Computer Science/ Electronics as optional subjects in the qualifying examination is eligible to pursue an undergraduate degree in engineering at MSRIT.
  • The eligibility for admission is 45% in case of General Category and 40% marks in the qualifying examination in case of SC/ST, Category-1 and OBC Category candidates. The marks obtained by the candidate in Biotechnology/ Biology/ Computer Science/ Electronics in the qualifying examination will be considered in the place of Chemistry in case the marks obtained in Chemistry is less for the required aggregate percentage for the purpose of determination of eligibility (and not for the purpose of determination of rank, in respect of engineering/technology courses).
  • Entrance Exam: KEA / COMEDK
